title: Sacramento Sheriff Social Media Query #4 UPDATED Social Media Monitoring 2025

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Sacramento Sheriff Social Media Query #4 UPDATED Social Media Monitoring 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Number, if any, of Social Media Monitoring software packages or service agreements in place with this department or agency. Please specify if software has been purchased or if services are performed by outside contractors for the department or agency.

- Any documents or correspondence during the period encompassing this request regarding possible or planned acquisition of Social Media Monitoring software packages or service agreements.

- Any existing or proposed usage policies regarding the use of Social Media Monitoring software packages or service agreements. including protocols, training documents, data storage procedures and prohibited activities.

- Any current or past litigation involving or referencing this department or agency involving the use of Social Media Monitoring Software Packages or Service Contractors.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robbie Powelson

title: Complaints to IRS About USS Liberty Veterans Association's Tax Exempt Status

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Complaints to IRS About USS Liberty Veterans Association's Tax Exempt Status
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: Inquiry Regarding Complaints and Investigation Status of USS Liberty Veterans Association’s 501(c)(3) Status

Dear Madam or Sir,

I am James Russell, an independent journalist who covered the USS Liberty Veterans Association’s (LVA) reunion in June 2025, where individuals associated with extremist views were invited as keynote speakers. 

Following the event, concerned citizens filed complaints challenging the LVA’s 501(c)(3) tax-exempt status because of hate speech.

I am requesting information on the number of complaints filed against the LVA’s 501(c)(3) status and the current status of any related investigations, and names of individuals who filed the complaints. 

Please provide any available details or direct me to the appropriate office for further information.

Thank you for your assistance.

Sincerely,
James Russell

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

JAMES RUSSELL

title: Medicaid Data Agreement between DHS and the Centers of Medicare and Medicaid Services (Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

### Background ###

A widely read media report said that "Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials will be given access to the personal data of the nation’s 79 million Medicaid enrollees, including home addresses and ethnicities, to track down immigrants who may not be living legally in the United States, according to an agreement obtained by The Associated Press. The information will give ICE officials the ability to find 'the location of aliens' across the country, says the agreement signed Monday between the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services and the Department of Homeland Security." You can read the report here: https://apnews.com/article/immigration-medicaid-trump-ice-ab9c2267ce596089410387bfcb40eeb7

My request is seeking a copy of this agreement.

### Request ###

- A copy of this agreement between DHS and the Centers of Medicare and Medicaid Services
- If you are not able to search for the agreement based on that request language, I alternatively request a copy of all agreements between DHS and the Centers of Medicare and Medicaid Services, from 1st January 2025 to the present.

To aid in the search, a direct quote of the agreement is "ICE will use the CMS data to allow ICE to receive identity and location information on aliens identified by ICE"

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am a journalist writing for 404 Media and that this request is being made as part of news gathering.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joseph Cox

title: Ohio Public Records Request – Body-Worn Camera - Arrest of Paige Cox (Aug 23, 2022)

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Ohio Public Records Request – Body-Worn Camera - Arrest of Paige Cox (Aug 23, 2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records related to the arrest of Paige Cox (born 06/08/1994) on August 23, 2022, by the Cincinnati Police Department.

The arrest followed a single-vehicle crash. Ms. Cox refused a chemical test after being read Ohio's ALS form, and was cited under R.C. 4511.19. The arrest occurred in Hamilton County, Ohio.

The involved officers were identified by the following badge numbers:

• Badge P895 – Arresting Officer
• Badge P492 – Witness Officer

The enforcement location was listed as 3201 Warsaw Ave, Cincinnati, OH 45205.

I am requesting:

All body-worn camera (BWC) and dash camera footage from officers P895 and P492 and any related patrol vehicles that were at the scene.

Please provide the records in digital format (via email or downloadable link). If any records are withheld, I request a written explanation citing specific legal exemptions under Ohio law.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

title: TDEM emails

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: TDEM emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Copies of all emails, including attachments, sent and received by Nim Kidd from 7/01/2025 through 7/09/2025.
- Copies of all emails, including attachments, sent and received by Warren Weidler from 7/01/2025 through 7/09/2025.
- Copies of all emails, including attachments, sent and received by Orlando Alanis from 7/01/2025 through 7/09/2025.

Expedited Processing Request
Pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E) and applicable regulations (e.g., 5 C.F.R. § 1303.10(d)), I request expedited processing on the grounds that there is an urgency to inform the public about potential federal government activity that could significantly affect technology policy and governance. The records requested have far-reaching implications for data privacy, employee retention, and litigation exposure. Delayed disclosure of these records would compromise the public’s timely understanding of critical government functioning. As a journalist actively reporting on the Federal Emergency Management Agency and the Texas Department of Emergency Management, I have a compelling need for expedited access to this information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Molly Taft

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

For the Flock system operated by Metro Transit and by any other Bi-State entities, please list the entity operating Flock devices, and:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3a. Flock networks shared with me

All body-worn camera footage, dash camera footage and traffic camera video related to the June 2, 2021, vehicle crash and arrest of Jasmine Christine Speach (DOB: 07/20/1998) at or near the intersection of US Highway 19 and Main Street, New Port Richey, FL 34652.

The incident is documented under agency report number 21-01874. The arresting or investigating agency may include the New Port Richey Police Department and/or Pasco County Sheriff's Office.

Specifically, I am requesting:

All body-worn camera recordings from officers on scene

All dash camera footage from responding patrol vehicles

Traffic camera footage, if applicable

If any portion of these materials is exempt, I request that all non-exempt portions be released and any redactions be justified with specific statutory exemptions.

I am requesting these records for non-commercial, journalistic purposes. I would prefer to receive the responsive materials in digital format via email or a downloadable link. Please inform me of any potential costs before fulfilling the request.

Thank you for your assistance. I look forward to your response in accordance with the timeline required under Florida law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Planning.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, Chapter 552 of the Texas Government Code, I hereby request the following records:

Request:
I respectfully request copies of all body-worn camera (BWC) and dash camera footage related to the arrest of Emekwanem Ogugua Biosah (DOB: 03/29/1990) on or about June 26, 2025, at approximately 4:55 PM in Harris County, Texas.

This request includes, but is not limited to:

All body-worn camera video captured by officers involved in the arrest or pursuit of Mr. Biosah, including any footage captured by Officer C. Offord or other personnel involved.

Any dash cam footage from marked patrol vehicles participating in the pursuit or stop.

Footage of the vehicle operation, pursuit, signal to stop, and the immediate aftermath of the arrest.

As described in D.A. Log Number 3167769 (Cause No. 257089201010 002, Harris County Criminal Court at Law No. 3), Mr. Biosah was charged with Fleeing or Attempting to Elude a Police Officer, following a pursuit initiated with emergency lights by Officer C. Offord in a marked vehicle.

This request is being made for non-commercial, journalistic, and public interest purposes.

If there are any fees, please inform me in advance. I prefer to receive the responsive records in digital format (via email or secure download). If necessary, please redact any exempt portions rather than withholding entire records.

I request a response within the 10 business days allowed under Texas law.

Thank you for your time and cooperation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Planning.

title: Energy and Innovation Summit

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Energy and Innovation Summit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The Pennsylvania Energy and Innovation Summit took place July 15, 2025 at Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) in Pittsburgh, PA. Media reporting has indicated that the Secret Service was involved in discussions about a fence being painted on the CMU campus: https://triblive.com/local/fence-fight-cmu-orders-students-anti-trump-message-painted-over-ahead-of-presidents-visit/

I request the following information:

1) Email communications containing any of the terms (not case sensitive) "fence", "paint", "repaint", "re-paint", "no rapists on our campus", "protest the summit", or "stop the summit" sent to or from an email address ending in @cmu.edu, @andrew.cmu.edu, or any other subdomain of cmu.edu between July 1, 2025 and July 16, 2025.

2) All communications (including emails, calendar invites, meeting notes, and other correspondence) with Farnam Jahanian (including but not limited to farnam@cmu.edu, farnam@andrew.cmu.edu, or president@andrew.cmu.edu), Gina Casalegno (gina.casalegno@cmu.edu or ginac@andrew.cmu.edu), and Daryl Weinert (dweinert@cmu.edu or dweinert@andrew.cmu.edu) between June 1, 2025 and July 16, 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Benjamin Weinshel

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I request all FBI records that reasonably describe references to Virginia Louise Giuffre (née Roberts), DOB: August 9, 1983 – DOD: April 25, 2025, in connection with the investigations of Jeffrey Edward Epstein (DOB: January 20, 1953 – DOD: August 10, 2019). This includes, but is not limited to:

Victim/witness statements, interviews, or FBI 302 summaries involving Giuffre

Internal memoranda, emails, or reports referencing Giuffre’s allegations

Communications between the FBI and other federal or state agencies referencing her

Any other documents discussing her death in relation to the Epstein or Maxwell investigations

Given Ms. Giuffre’s passing, Exemptions 6 and 7(C) do not apply. I request that all responsive records be provided electronically. Should the fees exceed $25, please notify me in advance.

Thank you. I expect a response within 20 business days as required by law.

Sincerely,
Kaycie Crossley

title: Texas Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Johnson County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Johnson County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

communications.subject: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Library Contract Request: Nexis Uni (University of Iowa)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The library's most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with library vendor Lexis Nexis relating to the licensing of the library database Nexis Uni; and

All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent in the library's or university's possession; and

All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations with language governing the use of the library database Nexis Uni in the library's or university's possession; and

All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations with language governing the use of the library database Nexis Uni in the library's or university's possession.

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of the library database Nexis Uni in the library's or university's possession.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

mo

title: Request to FBI for 2022 budget report for Office of Public Affairs

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to FBI for 2022 budget report for Office of Public Affairs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The 2022 annual budget report for the Office of Public Affairs of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo
